rev.diff:
Line 4: Line 4:
Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person, usually in the context of a [[romantic]] or interpersonal relationship; the accusation is that the person is so interpersonally controlling as to be better-suited to relationships with nonresponsive people.
Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person, usually in the context of a [[romantic]] or interpersonal relationship; the accusation is that the person is so interpersonally controlling as to be better-suited to relationships with nonresponsive people.
â   â
Necrophilia has also been a motive for some [[serial killer]]s, including murderers [[Ed Gein]], [[Richard Chase]], [[Winston Moseley]] and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], who ate his victims after killing them. Several other [[murder]]ers have described drawing sexual excitement from killing, as well, such as [[Karla Faye Tucker]], who claimed to have an [[orgasm]] with each swing of the [[axe]] she used to kill Jerry Lynn Dean. The guilty-plea testimony provided by the recently captured ([[2005]]) serial killer [[Dennis Rader]] provided a rare public glimpse into the workings of such a controlling mind.
  â   â
== Consensuality issue ==
  â
A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive, it amounts to the [[rape]] of a dead person. Virtually all human [[society | societies]] condemn abuse of the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect. In rare cases, however, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.
  â   â
== Health and safety issues ==
  â
Stories have circulated for many years about catching horrible diseases due to sexual contact with decomposing corpses. Many of them appear to be urban legends. However, it is safe to assume that medical examiners wash their hands both before ''and'' after their work.
 
== Necrophilia in neo-psychoanalysis ==
== Necrophilia in neo-psychoanalysis ==
Line 17: Line 9:
For Erich Fromm necrophilia is the opposite of [[biophilia]]. The lack of love in the western society leads to necrophilia. Symbols of the necrophile are facades made of concrete and steel, modern weapon systems, the idolatry of the technology of the megamachine ([[technophilia]]), the wasting of resources in [[consumerism]] and the treatment of people as things in [[bureaucracy|bureaucratism]].
For Erich Fromm necrophilia is the opposite of [[biophilia]]. The lack of love in the western society leads to necrophilia. Symbols of the necrophile are facades made of concrete and steel, modern weapon systems, the idolatry of the technology of the megamachine ([[technophilia]]), the wasting of resources in [[consumerism]] and the treatment of people as things in [[bureaucracy|bureaucratism]].
â   â
== Necrophilia in the arts ==
  â
While not necrophilia, [[Romanticism | romantic]] connections between [[romantic love | love]] and [[death]] are a frequent theme in [[Western_culture | Western]] [[art]]istic expression.
  â
*In the Greek legend of the [[Trojan War]], the Greek hero [[Achilles]] slays the [[Amazons|Amazon]] queen [[Penthesilea]] in a duel. Upon removing her helmet and seeing her face, Achilles falls in love with her and mourns her death. The soldier [[Thersites]] openly ridicules Achilles and accuses him of necrophilia. Achilles responds by promptly killing Thersites with a single blow. ''(In some traditions, Thersites' accusation is not unfounded--Achilles was so stricken by Panthesilea's beauty that he could not control his lust for her, even after her death.)''
  â
*The [[William Shakespeare | Shakespeare]] [[tragedy]] ''[[Romeo and Juliet]]'' ends with the young lovers united in death.
  â
*[[Edgar Allen Poe]] once described the death of a beautiful young woman to be one of the most [[beauty | beautiful]] images. (By this, he was not saying that it is a good thing for young women to die; to him [[melancholy]] and pain were sources of beauty.)
  â   â   â
Several [[rock (music)|rock]] artists also focus on the connection between romantic love and death, despair, and the occult:
  â
*In the [[1970s]], shock rocker [[Alice Cooper]] recorded a couple of songs about necrophilia, "I Love the Dead", and "Cold Ethyl".
  â
*In [[Europe]], a notable example is [[HIM (band) | HIM]], and more generally the artists of the [[love metal]] movement.
  â
*[[United States | American]] [[industrial rock]] band [[Stabbing Westward]] has many songs dealing with [[despair]], [[drug abuse]], [[sexual abuse]], [[death]], and [[romantic love]], often in conjunction.
  â
*[[Horror punk]] band [[Murderdolls]], led by [[Wednesday 13]], has created a life style out of singing about Necrophilia and sexual acts with the dead.
  â
*In the [[1980s]] and [[1990s | 1990s]], necrophilia emerged in the [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] sub-genres of [[death metal]], [[black metal]] and [[goregrind]].
  â
*In [[1993]], a [[music video]] for [[Tom Petty]]'s hit song "[[Mary Jane's Last Dance]]" featured the singer simulating various romantic poses with a dead woman (played by [[Kim Basinger]]).
  â   â   â
An extension of the emotional connection between love and death is love for a person, which remains after death. Some [[ghost stories]] focus on a deceased person's undying love for a living individual, manifest literally in the form of a palpable [[ghost]] or [[poltergeist]]. While it is considered a romantic image for a person to die "in the arms" of a lover, sexual activity with the dead is usually considered [[taboo]], but has appeared in recent [[film]] and [[music]].
  â   â
''Resurrection erotica'' is a set of artistic sub-genres wherein a person is brought back from a nonresponsive state (death, or a coma) by an expression, sometimes graphically physical, of romantic or sexual love. An example of this in [[fairy tale]] is the [[Sleeping Beauty]] parable.
  â   â
The [[controversial]] [[Germany | German]] film [[Nekromantik]] offers a graphic portrayal of sexual necrophilia, and the [[Canadian]] film ''[[Kissed]]'' is about a woman who works in a morgue and finds herself erotically drawn to the corpses she deals with.
  â   â
==Among animals==
  â   â
Necrophilia appears to be common in animals, with a number of confirmed observations. Kees Moeliker made one of these observations while he was sitting in his office at the Natuurmuseum Rotterdam, when he heard the distinctive thud of a bird hitting the glass facade of the building. Upon inspection, he discovered a drake mallard lying dead about two meters from the building. Next to the downed bird there was a second drake mallard standing close by. As he observed the odd couple, the living drake picked at the corpse of the dead one for a few minutes and then, without provocation, it mounted the corpse and began copulating with it. The act of necrophilia lasted for about 75 minutes, in which time, according to Moeliker, the living drake took two short breaks before resuming with copulating behavior. Moeliker surmised that at the time of the collision with the window the two mallards were engaged in a common motif in [[duck]] behavior which is called [[rape flight]]. "When one died the other one just went for it and didn't get any negative feedback -- well, didn't get any feedback," according to Moeliker. This is the first recorded case of homosexual necrophilia in the [[Mallard duck]].
  â   â
Source: Guardian, Research News, 2/8/05, Donald MacLeod. "Necrophilia among ducks ruffles research feathers".
  â   â
== In popular culture ==
  â   â
Satirical songwriter [[Tom Lehrer]], whose [[1950s]] recordings mentioned many topics not normally openly discussed in those days, referenced a friend of his who "wrote a heartwarming story about a young necrophiliac who finally achieved his lifelong ambition by becoming Coroner!" Lehrer gave the audience a few seconds to murmur in bewilderment, and then said, "The rest of you can look it up when you get home!"
  â   â
The 1985 film ''Brazil'' by Terry Gilliam has a reference toward the end of the story.
  â   â
In [[1996]], a Russian band called ''Sexual Minorities'' ("Ð¡ÐµÐºÑÑÐ°Ð»ÑÐ½ÑÐµ Ð¼ÐµÐ½ÑÑÐ¸Ð½ÑÑÐ²Ð°" in Russian) released the album titled ''Necrophilia - The Cold Ten'' (in Russian, "ÐÐµÐºÑÐ¾ÑÐ¸Ð»Ð¸Ñ - Ð¥Ð¾Ð»Ð¾Ð´Ð½Ð°Ñ ÐÐµÑÑÑÐºÐ°"), which contained parodies of Russian pop-songs.
  â   â
In [[2002]], [[World Wrestling Entertainment]] ran the infamous [[Katie Vick]] [[angle (professional wrestling)|storyline]] as part of a [[feud (professional wrestling)|feud]] between [[Paul Levesque|Triple H]] and [[Glen Jacobs|Kane]]. In the storyline, Triple H accused Kane of killing Katie Vick, who had rejected Kane's romantic advances, and raping her corpse. Triple H also threatened to show footage of Kane's "crimes." Later, he showed the alleged footage, which clearly showed Triple H dressed as Kane simulating an act of necrophilia on a mannequin dressed as Vick. The reaction from viewers and wrestling fans alike was so negative that WWE was forced to quickly end the storyline.
  â   â
''[[Mikelangelo and the Black Sea Gentlemen]]'' mention necrophilia in their song ''Formidable Marinade'' on the album ''Journey through the Sea of Shadows''
  â   â
